abilities_ref.name: High Sorcery
abilities_ref.desc: A Loremaster’s knowledge of magic goes far beyond that of any other race. When an enemy spellcaster successfully casts a spell the Loremaster may attempt to dispel it. If the Loremaster rolls greater then his opponent’s casting roll for the spell then it is dispelled. Only the Loremaster may have this skill.

abilities_ref.name: Stand and Fire
abilities_ref.desc: If the Elf passes a leadership test he may choose to stand and fire at a charging opponent. The Elf suffers a –1 penalty to hit and may only fire once, at a single opponent. If his opponent is knocked down or stunned, place him halfway between the Elf and where he started from (or in view if he was out of sight).

abilities_ref.name: Miniath
abilities_ref.desc: The Elf has been trained in the martial art of the White Tower known as Miniath, allowing him to parry with any weapon. If he has a weapon that he can parry with he gains an additional parry attempt.

abilities_ref.name: Unerring Strike
abilities_ref.desc: The Elf is an expert at delivering deadly accurate blows. He may re-roll any failed to wound rolls.

abilities_ref.name: Fey Quickness
abilities_ref.desc: Few can ever hope to match an Elf’s inhuman quickness and agility. An Elf with Fey Quickness can avoid melee or missile attacks on a roll of 6. If the Elf also has Step Aside or Dodge this will increase to a 4+ in the relevant area. For example, an Elf with Fey Quickness and Step Aside avoids melee attacks on a 4+ and missile attacks on a 6.
